name: tactilely
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that relates to the sense of touch, to the action of touching people or things, or to how things feel when you touch them: The shiny shapes are tactilely and visually compelling, to the extent that it will be difficult to look without touching. The keyboard was tactilely and in appearance modelled on an electric typewriter.
in a way that makes something seem real, as if it can be touched or physically felt: The photographs make us feel very tactilely how cramped the residents' lives are. These planetary systems almost feel tactilely like our solar system.
More examplesFewer examplesTouch is our most active sense - we can perceive something visually or acoustically without effort, but to learn about something tactilely, we have to move.He agrees that the smooth surface of a photograph may be less tactilely pleasurable than a textured layer of paint.
